title: VaxDa
author: VaxDa
content: Hi, does anybody knows the birthday of the well know scammer Vladislav Alimpiev from the fraud company localbitcoins.com?Thanks you and a happy new year!

comments.author: B353N
comments.body: Here is not Q&A section, please use correct form

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: VaxDa on January 01, 2023, 12:41:20 PMHi, does anybody knows the birthday of the well know scammer Vladislav Alimpiev from the fraud company localbitcoins.com?Thanks you and a happy new year!If you have a complaint about that guy follow the right format and just add your question about the guy if you already created a complaint then just post there about your birthday, and it's better to move this thread to another section like the service section or if the company has an existing thread you post your question there, I don't know why you're asking for the birthday of the guy who I think scammed you., are you going to send him a gift or greet him.

comments.author: VaxDa
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on January 01, 2023, 11:16:22 PMQuote from: VaxDa on January 01, 2023, 12:41:20 PMHi, does anybody knows the birthday of the well know scammer Vladislav Alimpiev from the fraud company localbitcoins.com?Thanks you and a happy new year!If you have a complaint about that guy follow the right format and just add your question about the guy if you already created a complaint then just post there about your birthday, and it's better to move this thread to another section like the service section or if the company has an existing thread you post your question there, I don't know why you're asking for the birthday of the guy who I think scammed you., are you going to send him a gift or greet him.I deposit almost 1 Bitcoin to my account, and when I want to sell it I cant sell, saying I am in a holiday mode. Asking the costumer service to fix the problem hat no result. These scammers refuse to unlock my account.Thats why I want to find out more about these scammers and send them a greetings.

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: VaxDa on January 06, 2023, 02:52:14 AMI deposit almost 1 Bitcoin to my account, and when I want to sell it I cant sell, saying I am in a holiday mode. Use a correct format so that it is easier for everyone to understand what actually happened (instead of one liner accusation with no proofs).Quote from: VaxDa on January 06, 2023, 02:52:14 AMAsking the costumer service to fix the problem hat no result. These scammers refuse to unlock my account.What did they say? Please post PM/chat/mail logs of the customer support.PS: From the localbitcoins website> "Account can get suspended automatically, if our system notices any unusual activities from the profile, or LocalBitcoin support team manually flags it in case they have a good reason to suspect fraud or account hack.". Check if you're account is involved in any malicious activites.

comments.author: VaxDa
comments.body: Quote from: Edwardard on January 06, 2023, 03:09:59 AMQuote from: VaxDa on January 06, 2023, 02:52:14 AMAsking the costumer service to fix the problem hat no result. These scammers refuse to unlock my account.What did they say? Please post PM/chat/mail logs of the customer support.PS: From the localbitcoins website> "Account can get suspended automatically, if our system notices any unusual activities from the profile, or LocalBitcoin support team manually flags it in case they have a good reason to suspect fraud or account hack.". Check if you're account is involved in any malicious activites.Through costumer ticket.They say my account is locked and can not be unlocked. When I ask why, they say they cant say anything, because its confidential.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: VaxDa on January 07, 2023, 04:46:50 AMQuote from: Edwardard on January 06, 2023, 03:09:59 AMQuote from: VaxDa on January 06, 2023, 02:52:14 AMAsking the costumer service to fix the problem hat no result. These scammers refuse to unlock my account.What did they say? Please post PM/chat/mail logs of the customer support.PS: From the localbitcoins website> "Account can get suspended automatically, if our system notices any unusual activities from the profile, or LocalBitcoin support team manually flags it in case they have a good reason to suspect fraud or account hack.". Check if you're account is involved in any malicious activites.Through costumer ticket.They say my account is locked and can not be unlocked. When I ask why, they say they cant say anything, because its confidential.You're so kind, imagine you've been scammed 1 BTC and yet you're still going to greet the guy who scammed you, if it's true that you have been scammed, then follow the correct format and tell us what happen and the amount that you've been scammed,Here is the right format if you missed it Code:[b][color=black]What happened:: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Scammers Profile Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Reference Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Amount Scammed: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Payment Method: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Proof of Payment: [/color][/b][b][color=black]PM/Chat Logs: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Additional Notes: [/color][/b]r

comments.author: VaxDa
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on January 07, 2023, 05:19:04 AMQuote from: VaxDa on January 07, 2023, 04:46:50 AMQuote from: Edwardard on January 06, 2023, 03:09:59 AMQuote from: VaxDa on January 06, 2023, 02:52:14 AMAsking the costumer service to fix the problem hat no result. These scammers refuse to unlock my account.What did they say? Please post PM/chat/mail logs of the customer support.PS: From the localbitcoins website> "Account can get suspended automatically, if our system notices any unusual activities from the profile, or LocalBitcoin support team manually flags it in case they have a good reason to suspect fraud or account hack.". Check if you're account is involved in any malicious activites.Through costumer ticket.They say my account is locked and can not be unlocked. When I ask why, they say they cant say anything, because its confidential.You're so kind, imagine you've been scammed 1 BTC and yet you're still going to greet the guy who scammed you,Well there are also evil greetings. I want to know more about these scammers and hire a group to bust him.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: VaxDa on January 07, 2023, 12:02:32 PMQuote from: coin-investor on January 07, 2023, 05:19:04 AMQuote from: VaxDa on January 07, 2023, 04:46:50 AMQuote from: Edwardard on January 06, 2023, 03:09:59 AMQuote from: VaxDa on January 06, 2023, 02:52:14 AMAsking the costumer service to fix the problem hat no result. These scammers refuse to unlock my account.What did they say? Please post PM/chat/mail logs of the customer support.PS: From the localbitcoins website> "Account can get suspended automatically, if our system notices any unusual activities from the profile, or LocalBitcoin support team manually flags it in case they have a good reason to suspect fraud or account hack.". Check if you're account is involved in any malicious activites.Through costumer ticket.They say my account is locked and can not be unlocked. When I ask why, they say they cant say anything, because its confidential.You're so kind, imagine you've been scammed 1 BTC and yet you're still going to greet the guy who scammed you,Well there are also evil greetings. I want to know more about these scammers and hire a group to bust him.What do you mean by evil greetings I hope you know what you're doing your post is public it sounds like you want to do something bad to do guy, why not cut the craft and follow the right format tell us the whole story, what really happened how much he scammed to you, this thread will be index by Google and it will show when someone does research on his reputation instead of just giving an evil greeting that could backfire.
